subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 15, 2007

TOP STORIESIs "Alli" The Holy Grail For Dieters?
The first FDA-approved, over-the-counter weight loss pill has hit the shelves of American stores. Dieters are being drawn
                        in by Alli's claims that it can block fat from being absorbed by the body. But the pill has some potentially messy drawbacks. More...
• Gaza: War Of Bullets Now A War Of Words
                     					| Watch• NASA: "We're In Good Shape"
                     					| Watch• Gates Makes Surprise Iraq VisitU.S.1957 Plymouth Unearthed After 50 Years
As part of a time capsule sealed in 1957, Tulsa residents buried a Plymouth Belvedere in a vault (designed to withstand a
                        nuclear attack) to be opened in 2007. They were also generous: they also buried 10 gallons of gas and a case of beer.  More...Watch: Time Capsule Car Unearthed
• Cops Release Husband In SUV Killings Case
                     					| Watch• Arrest Made In Baseball Bat Beating Death• Duke DA: I Got "Carried Away"
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldPrincess Di's Sons Speak About Tribute
Prince William and Prince Harry, right, parade in suits and bowler hats with the Combined Cavalry Old Comrades' Association
                        in Hyde Park, London, on Sunday, May 13, 2007. More...Watch: Princes Remember Diana
• Muggings Not Terror Worry Algerians• 5 U.S. Troops Killed In Iraq
                     					| Watch• Russia Probing Alleged U.K. Espionage
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsHouse Reaffirms Reforms On Earmarks
Democratic and Republican leaders cut a deal to raise the standards of transparency and accountability in the House. The deal
                        restores a requirement to disclose all member-sponsored projects, including the right to challenge such earmarks.  More...Watch: Buried In The Fine Print
• Schwarzenegger: Don't Watch Spanish TV• Pure Horserace: A Small Price To Pay
                     					| Watch• Red Nation, Blue Nation
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthAll About Alli, The Weight Loss Pill
Experts explain the benefits and side effects of Alli, the over-the-counter diet pill. It's a lower dosage of Xenical, which
                        requires a prescription. Even though it's not being billed as a magic bullet, many consumers may see it as one anyway. More...
• Minnesota Sextuplets Struggle to Survive• Army To Beef Up Mental Health Help• Gastric Bypass? Bypass The Booze• More StoriesSciTechNASA: "We're In Good Shape"
NASA says it has no plans to unstaff the international space station if a failed computer system operated by the agency's
                        Russian partners can't be restored. Two astronauts from the space shuttle Atlantis began a spacewalk to fix a suspect connector. More...Watch: Fixing Space Station Glitch
• New Drug Can Help Fat Fido Shed Pounds
                     					| Watch• Second Rare Shark Dies In Aquarium Mystery
                     					| Watch• Texas Nabs Predators On MySpace 
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessHow To Cut Your Health Care Costs
Paying cash, shopping around for medical services and looking for prescription bargains can help you cut your health care
                        costs. More...
• Cheap Gas Gets The Job Done
                     					| Watch• Final Tribute For Cream Of Wheat Man• 27,000 Ford Workers Take Buyouts• More StoriesEntertainment50 Cent Not Testifying At Iverson Trial
Rapper 50 Cent will not testify at Allen Iverson's assault trial this month, as he only knows the security guards accused
                        and was not involved in the altercation.
                         More...Watch: 50 Cent On His Role In 'Brave'
• Bob Barker Says "Goodbye Everybody"

                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionRomney: Stem-Cell Solution Is In Reach
Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney, writing in the National Review Online, says partisans should
                        quit playing politics and support new ways of creating embryonic stem cells that avoid ethical hurdles. More...

Immigration Bill Gains SupportThe once-stalled immigration reform bill will return to the Senate floor  after some tweaking and more pushing by its chief
                                    supporter, President Bush. Susan Roberts reports.
